attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the final Brexit deal
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to give the people of this country the final say on the Brexit deal negotiated by the UK and EU. This would be done through a referendum that would take place prior to the April 2019 exit date.
attributes.additional_details:
The referendum would allow for three options: 

(1)	To revoke Article 50, thereby keeping Britain in the EU
(2)	To reject the UK-EU deal and leave the EU
(3)	To accept the UK-EU deal and leave the EU

If no agreement has been negotiated by the UK and EU before the date of the referendum, then the third option could be removed. If all three options remain, it may be necessary for the vote to take place using a Single Transferable Vote to ensure no option is disadvantaged. 

Regardless of whether individuals voted to remain or leave the EU in the June 2016 EU referendum, everyone should have a chance to decide their future based on the final agreement negotiated between the UK and EU.

attributes.action: Make fair transitional state pension arrangements for 1950’s women
attributes.background: That this Government without delay recognises the need for a non-means tested bridging pension for women born on or after 6/4/1950 who are affected by the 1995 and 2011 Pension Acts and compensate those at risk of losing up to around £45,000, to also give proper notification for any future changes.
attributes.additional_details: The 1995 Conservative Government’s Pension Act included plans to increase women’s SPA to 65, the same as men’s. Women Against State Pension Inequality (WASPI), agree with equalisation, but don’t agree with the unfair way the changes were implemented – with little/no personal notice (1995/2011 Pension Acts), faster than promised (2011 Pension Act), and no time to make alternative plans. Retirement plans have been shattered with devastating consequences.

attributes.action: Make British Sign Language part of the National Curriculum
attributes.background: Around 50,000 people in the UK use British Sign Language, so why is this not taught in schools? There are many children who are born deaf, and we need to give them a better chance at a more integrated future. This is why BSL needs to be taught in schools.

attributes.action: Fund research into pediatric brain cancer & earlier access to experimental drugs
attributes.background: A classroom of innocent UK school children is dying every year to an incurable brain cancer called Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG), but globally over 200,000 children in the last 50 years have lost their lives to this death sentence of an illness. This needs to end & a cure needs to be found
attributes.additional_details:
DIPG:
• No cure to date 
• Mainly affect children between 4-12 years
• Average survival time from diagnosis is 9 months. 
• Every 9 days a child in the UK is diagnosed
• Survival rate +5 years: DIPG 1962-0% 2017-0% vs Leukaemia 1962-4% 2017-94%
• Only 1% of the UK national spend on cancer research has been allocated to brain cancer.

ACTION:
• Fund research into paediatric DIPG brain cancer
• Earlier access to multi modal experimental drugs & delivery system
• UK to be global ambassador for DIPG

attributes.action: Pay Up Now! – Scrap the pay cap and give public servants a meaningful pay rise
attributes.background: Every single person who works in public services needs and deserve a pay rise. It’s time for the pay cap to be scrapped, for the government to provide additional funding for public sector pay and for employers to put public sector workers pay up now.
attributes.additional_details: For more than seven years, everyone who works in public services has seen their pay decline, thanks to the public sector pay cap. Inflation is currently at 2.9%, meaning that the cap is a significant annual pay cut for those public service champions – nurses, care workers, teaching assistants, social workers and so many others - who work for all of us. Public sector pay has risen by just 4.4% between 2010 and 2016 while the cost of living rose by 22%.

attributes.action: Reduce the age of Mandatory Mammograms to age 25-30
attributes.background:
I was diagnosed with breast cancer age 36, at 37 I was told it was terminal. I have a 7 year old daughter who has already lost her dad to heart disease. 
Because of my age, I never dreamt I'd have breast cancer
attributes.additional_details:
I know of a huge amount of women/men diagnosed with breast cancer between the age of 23-40 most are now terminally ill and leaving children & babies behind. 
I want everyone to have a better chance of survival; not only for themselves, but for their children, parents, siblings, friends. 

Cancer does not discriminate, it doesn't care how old or fit you are or whether you're male or female, so why are mandatory mammograms only available for women 50+

We need change!!!

attributes.action: Lobster Pots and Small Craft Safety – time to change the rules!
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, urge the Minister of State (DEFRA) to improve the way static fishing gear is marked for the safety of all small craft at sea. The current, voluntary, guidance is not adequate. We ask that DEFRA seeks views regarding enforceable regulation among other options.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is sponsored by the Cruising Association (CA). We believe that the current, voluntary, arrangements and guidance have not been adequate and that the number of call-outs, by the RNLI and coastguard, to small craft disabled by fouled propellers and rudders shows the significance of the problem. We hope that all stakeholders will work together, with DEFRA, to find a solution, particularly one that is cheap and practical for our fishermen.

attributes.action: Improve Availability of NHS Services for FND Sufferers
attributes.background: Functional Neurological Disorder sufferers are often left with limited & insufficient treatment options. Treatment requires a team of neurologists, physiotherapists etc. which must be integrated to create an effective plan. Currently, services are not equipped for this kind of specialist care.
attributes.additional_details: Up to 1/3 of all neurological referrals are diagnosed with FND. Sufferers end up relinquishing their independence & become reliant on a carer.  They are left unable to function & it’s vital we improve prospects. Medically Unexplained Symptoms (including FND) directly cost the NHS approximately £3.1 billion, with an additional £18 billion in indirect costs. With an NHS already under pressure, improving services and treatment for those with FND would greatly lift this burden.

attributes.action: Resolve the inequity/inconsistency refunding for NHS trainees under WAT schemes
attributes.background: The WAT scheme introduced to assists NHS workers improve their knowledge on a qualifying WAT course, any payments received was to be exempt from Income tax and NI'. Virtually all staff had tax and NI deducted but reclaiming these payments for many is inequitable, inconsistent and often refused.
attributes.additional_details: The Government's refund guidelines for NHS workers quotes 'Payments made by employers to workers getting full-time instruction can be exempt from Income Tax & NI contributions if certain conditions are met' (Gov.uk).  The responses from HMRC and Trusts when trying to reclaim Tax & NI has proved to be a long laborious, inconsistent process, with lack of clarity and lack of publication of refund possibilities. Some have received Tax & NI, some only tax and others nothing whilst identical contracts.

attributes.action: To have a second referendum on Brexit once a final agreement with the EU agreed.
attributes.background: Whether we stay or go, I believe that final decision should only be based on clear and understandable information. It is clear that our and EU politicians are more interested in their own politicking rather than ensuring a stable and highly productive Country/Countries.
attributes.additional_details: Inner city Manchester Born and Bred. Degree in Economics. Lived in Moss Side/Whalley Range, Weybridge, Warsaw, Geneva and now back in Weybridge. Have two exceptional daughters for whom I have the only desire to leave a better world for them and future generations. Incredible friends around the world. Together we are something, alone we are nothing. Let's make sure any decision we reach is based on fact not fiction.

attributes.action: Voluntary Right to Buy (VRTB) Scheme for Housing Associations - Update Needed
attributes.background: This petition calls for an update from UK government on the Voluntary Right to Buy Scheme which proposes for the Right to Buy to be extended to Housing Association tenants in England (as pledged in Conservative Manifesto in 2015, piloted with 5 associations and gaining Royal Assent in 2016).
attributes.additional_details:
The government should confirm intentions to deliver the scheme nationally as pledged in 2015. Detail is needed on the timeline for when the scheme will be rolled out nationally, and what the criteria will be for those wishing to apply to purchase their home. 

www.twitter.com/RTBforHA
www.facebook.com/RTBforHA/

attributes.action: Impose 5% levy on the Premier League’s broadcasting rights back into  grassroots
attributes.background: We call on Government to impose a 5% levy on The Premier League's £8.3bn combined revenue from UK and international TV deal for 2016-2019 to be reinvested back into Grassroots football
attributes.additional_details:
Cuts by government to local councils are having a huge impact on Grassroots football across the country with most authorities not able to fund grassroots football anymore while the Premier League clubs have just spent £1.4bn in this summers transfer window.

As many Grassroots clubs and teams struggle to survive in these difficult times with ever increasing fees and a lack of affordable facilities both indoor and out, we call on government to impose a 5% levy so that the £billions at the top of the tree reach the roots, the starting place for every football player

attributes.action: Debate in Parliament the lack of an effective policy for the treatment of M.E.
attributes.background: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME) means "muscle pain plus inflammation of the brain/spinal cord", a chronic neurological illness, but "the majority of patients presenting with symptoms of ME in the UK are still referred to psychotherapists for treatment" (Dr Ian Gibson). A policy review is overdue.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS provides psychiatric therapies for what it refers to as "CFS/ME". These therapies are often ineffective and sometimes make patients worse. They are the result of a Myalgic Encephalomyelitis policy heavily influenced by psychiatrists who are skeptical about the existence of Myalgic Encephalomyelitis. It is time for a policy re-think about the effectiveness (and cost-effectiveness) of current treatment.
See: http://www.tymestrust.org (for the effect of current policy on children with ME).

attributes.action: Establish an independent body to fact-check the things said during campaigning
attributes.background: In a year where the Oxford English Dictionary names its Word of the Year as 'post-truth', then something has gone wrong in the politics & campaining world. This is a petition asking for the establishing of an independent department that will ensure truthful politics.
attributes.additional_details: We had the infamous claim that if we leave the EU, instead of sending £350 million a week to the EU; we can send it to the NHS; and then after the result declaring that we didn't actually send the EU that much money, & also it wouldn't be going directly to the NHS. This new department should consist of teams from Ofcom, Advertising Agency, CPS, ONS and electoral lawyers (etc) to ensure that no politician can mislead the public with unsubstantiated claims and that UK politics are truthful.

attributes.action: Extend paternity leave from 2 weeks to at least 4
attributes.background: 2 weeks is not enough time to help with the mother and bond with the baby. 4 weeks should easily be the minimum to give dad's a better chance to bond and give the mother more support.
attributes.additional_details:
Men suffer from postnatal depression too. I did, and I went sick for 4 weeks. Having these extra weeks helped me bond with the baby instead of never seeing her due to work. Here's my story:

https://youtu.be/mt-yyjEotE0

This is something that benefits both the mother and the father, and is incredibly important for bonding in the early stages of a babies life.

attributes.action: All high-rise tower blocks over 30 metres must have sprinklers installed.
attributes.background: Sprinklers save the lives of tower block residents and firefighters. Lives could have been saved in the fatal fires at Grenfell Tower and Lakanal House in London, and at Shirley Towers in Southampton. The new law should include a duty on local authorities and the local fire service to enforce.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2013, the Coroner of the Shirley Towers fire recommended that:
"Social housing providers should be encouraged to consider the retrofitting of sprinklers in all existing high-rise buildings in excess of 30 metres in height." Fire experts recommend sprinklers too. Yet in all this time, seven years after Shirley Towers, councils and housing providers have failed to install sprinklers. We should not wait for the Grenfell Tower investigations to complete. The law must change NOW.

attributes.action: A review for tougher sentences for all of One Punch assaults and fatalities
attributes.background:
The law states that one punch assaults are sentenced to GBH which is up to 5yrs but usually get 2.5yrs. 
Manslaughter which is up to 10yrs but get 3 to 5yrs. 
The sentence does not reflect the severity of the damage that is caused by a one punch assault.
attributes.additional_details:
A review for tougher sentences for all of one punch assaults and fatalities. 
The law states that one punch assaults are sentenced to GBH which is up to 5yrs but usually get 2.5yrs. 
The sentence does not reflect the severity of the damage that is caused by a one punch assault: 
• Death 
• Catastrophic brain injury 
• Long slow recovery rate 
• Huge effect on victims , families, friends, community

attributes.action: Require HMRC to separate out the cost of Brexit on personal tax statements.
attributes.background: The UK Government is taking us out of the EU whatever the cost. During the referendum campaign, much was made of the cost of membership of the EU. There will be costs to leave the EU - public sector time, research and consultancy fees, legal costs, repayments, and so on. These should be identified.
attributes.additional_details: The 'Vote Leave' campaign advertised a fee of £350m per week going to the EU (£18.2bn per year), while the ONS calculates the true value to be £9.9bn per year (http://visual.ons.gov.uk/uk-perspectives-2016-the-uk-contribution-to-the-eu-budget/). Brexit is predicted to cost an additional £60bn (https://www.ft.com/content/51a19263-9788-37b9-a9fa-8cd307265edf). This will have consequences for government spending and tax rates - taxpayers must be able to understand where their money is being used.

attributes.action: Introduce an unconditional, Universal Basic Income
attributes.background:
With ever more jobs becoming automatable, risking vast unemployment, a regular unconditional dividend should be paid to every citizen to provide a decent standard of living and stimulate the economy from the bottom up.

This will also reduce crime, healthcare costs and improve education outcomes.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a further list of reasons to pay a basic income: http://www.basicincome.org.uk/reasons-support-basic-income

And some preliminary results from a trial in Finland: https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2017/05/finlands-basic-income-experiment-is-already-making-people-feel-better-after-just-4-months

And a study into the likely impact of automation on future employment:
http://www.oxfordmartin.ox.ac.uk/downloads/academic/The_Future_of_Employment.pdf

attributes.action: Reform the UK Voting System - Adopt Proportional Representation
attributes.background: We call for a new debate & Vote into replacing the current First Past The Post system with Proportional Representation. FPTP is out-dated & only benefits the larger, more established parties. It is unfit for the modern times. PR allows for the views of the country to be more accurately representated
attributes.additional_details: We ask the government not to dismiss this petition as they have done before, as whilst there was a vote in 2011, with only a 42% turnout (& was described by political scientist Iain McLean as "bad-tempered & ill-informed public debate") ; We believe opinions and the political landscape has now changed, so before you reject this, Please do additional research this year and next, such as with YouGov, & social media and if opinions have changed, as we believe, hence this petition, hold a new vote!

attributes.action: Suspend UK training the Burmese Armed Forces.
attributes.background: In 2017 the Burmese Armed Forces did something called Ethnic Cleansing to the Rohingya Muslims. Ethnic Cleansing is when they remove an ethnicity from their territory. It comes in forms like deportation and, in severe cases, mass murder and genocidal rape. Last year UK funded the Burma Army £305K.
attributes.additional_details: So far the Armed Forces have killed more than 1000 Muslims and 200,000 Muslims have been displaced from their homes and fled to other countries. They have also raped some women and have burnt people's homes. We the people paid the government so that they can make good use of it. We want them to stop funding the Burmese Armed Forces because of the actions they have done to the Muslims. Imagine if you were a 5yr old innocent child, you had fled to Bangladesh and your family had recently died. So please take action in Myanmar.

attributes.action: To install defibrillator into all workplaces with 5 or more employees.
attributes.background:
I train first aid courses as my job and when I tell people that there is no definitive law about defibrillators in the workplace all I get is "why not? they would save more lives".

Within the UK sudden cardiac arrest (SCA) is one of the leading causes of premature death.
attributes.additional_details:
Electrical defibrillation is well established as an effective treatment for sudden cardiac arrest, and, if defibrillation is delivered within 3-5 minutes, survival rates can be as high as 50-70%.

The H&S (first aid) Regs 1981 states:
First aid provision must be ‘adequate and appropriate in the circumstances’. 

This to some employers is just a first aider and a first aid kit and I feel this is not enough, so I want to do more into making sure someone has the best chance of survival in an emergency.

attributes.action: I want our country to increase our defence budget to 5% GDP to protect us better
attributes.background: We need to increase our defence budget. The world today is even more unpredictable and dangerous than it's ever been, from the likes of Russia and China being more assertive. I want the UK to be prepared for any major conflict that may come to light in the future and protect our citizens better.

attributes.action: Change the law in England to "opt out" for organ donations
attributes.background: In England, Scotland and Northern Ireland, your organs and tissue will only be used if you have given consent.  Wales changed to "opt out" in 2015 and Scotland is considering it.  England and NI rely on public awareness campaigns.
attributes.additional_details: In the first six months after the law change, there was a 38% reduction in the number of people in Wales waiting for a transplant.  Just 36% of people in the UK are now on the NHS Organ Donor Register, compared with 30% five years ago.  According to a recent BBC article http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-40564329  457 people died last year while on the waiting list, as they did not get a donor organ in time.  875 people became too ill to undergo transplant surgery.

attributes.action: Abolish prescription charges
attributes.background: England is the only part of the UK who still charges prescription charges. Prescription charges make medications unaffordable. The Prescription Charges Coalition found that 1 in 3 people with a long term condition who paid for their medications did not pick up their medication due to costs.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.prescriptionchargescoalition.org.uk/uploads/1/2/7/5/12754304/still_paying_the_price_june_2017.pdf

attributes.action: Make Student Nurses and Midwives eligible for 30 hours free childcare
attributes.background: Earlier in the year, the government introduced 30 hours of free childcare for 3-4 year olds in the UK. It has since emerged that this scheme ignores the workforce of Student Nurses and Midwives with children who work 30+ hours in the NHS, who are now without a bursary and have limited support.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017, Student Nurse and Midwifery applications fell by a staggering 23% after the abolition of NHS Bursaries. These students now need to take out loans and take up second jobs in order to make ends meet. This is even harder for students with children and often forces them to drop out after the first year of training.
There are 24,000 nursing posts in the UK which need filling. This is a change that could benefit thousands of Student Nurses and Midwives, and help fill those vacancies.

attributes.action: Stop NHS England from removing herbal and homeopathic medicines
attributes.background: NHS England is consulting on recommendations to remove herbal and homeopathic medicines from GP prescribing. The medicines cost very little and have no suitable alternatives for many patients. Therefore we call on NHS England to continue to allow doctors to prescribe homeopathy and herbal medicine.
attributes.additional_details: Many NHS patients either suffer such severe side-effects from pharmaceutical drugs they cannot take them, or have been given all other conventional medicines and interventions with no improvement to their health. These patients will continue to need treatment on the NHS and will end up costing the NHS more with conventional prescriptions. There will be no cost savings and patient health will suffer. It is clear stopping homeopathic & herbal prescriptions will not help but hurt the NHS.

attributes.action: Rescind Donald Trump's state visit invitation.
attributes.background: After Donald Trump was invited to make a state visit to the UK he used a terrorist attack in London to make political capital and to undermine the Mayor of London's response to that attack. The UK government should make its displeasure clear by rescinding his state visit invitation.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been other examples of Donald Trump's actions since the invitation was issued that show he does not deserve this honour:

- He said that there were "many fine people" participating in a neo-nazi / white supremacist rally.
- He equated the actions of those at the rally with the people protesting it.
- He declared transgender people unfit to serve in armed forces in any capacity.

The UK government should demonstrate a break from these values by rescinding the state visit invitation.

attributes.action: Allow same sex couples to both be on a birth certificate without being married
attributes.background: My partner and I are in a same-sex relationship and we wanted to have a baby. We couldn't afford private IVF and didn't want to use the NHS money when we could do it ourselves at home using a sperm donor. Baby born, now my partner isn't allowed on birth certificate because we weren't married.
attributes.additional_details: Because we didn't use a private clinic or the NHS and we weren't married at the time of conception my partner is unable to go on the birth certificate. She is now having to adopt our baby to get step parent rights instead of full parental rights, which is emotionally costly as well as financially. It now leaves our daughter's future uncertain should anything happen to me. In this day and age a birth certificate should state name of parents instead of gender specification.

attributes.action: Give all British citizens living abroad the right to vote and dedicated MPs
attributes.background: About 1 million British citizens living abroad do not have the right to vote due to their overseas residency exceeding 15 years. They therefore lack representation in Parliament. And, British Citizens living abroad for under 15 years may only vote in a constituency they no longer live in.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that all British citizens deserve genuine representation in Parliament. British citizens living abroad must be able to vote for an MP to represent their interests in the House of Commons. Having their own dedicated MPs would more efficiently address their concerns which are often different to UK residents’. This petition proposes to introduce votes for life and to add overseas constituencies with a dedicated MP for each constituency to better represent British Citizens living abroad.

attributes.action: Make the DNA testing of dogs compulsory in order to compile a national database
attributes.background: The DNA testing of dog mess is already offered by some companies and could be used to find a dog owner guilty of such an offence. The problem is there is no database for the DNA of dogs, and owners are not obliged by law to register them. A database would allow an unequivocal conviction to be made.

attributes.action: UK retailers to label all meat non-halal or halal so all religions have a choice
attributes.background: We want clearer labelling on all meat, including chicken. As most British meat does not state whether the meat is halal or non halal(haram). We want meat clearly labelled for all faiths and ethical backgrounds. So Christians, Muslim, Jewish, Sikh, etc should all have a choice in what meat they eat.
attributes.additional_details: We know people of all faiths, and have problems finding out whether the meat is non-halal or halal, as there is nothing stated on the packaging in British supermarkets/butchers. We think it is only fair that everyone of every faith should know which way the meat is slaughtered so everyone has a choice in what they are eating. There are no guidelines for consumers in making this choice for all ethical reasons. We want to see clearer labelling on every meat and chicken product sold in the UK.

attributes.action: When we have any election include a selection for “None of the above”.
attributes.background:
This would allow me to register my vote as none of the candidates represent me in my constituency. 

This would also give the public a way to show no confidence in the current sitting representative as opposed to voting for a candidate that I do not believe in.
attributes.additional_details: The only evidence I can put forward is the large numbers that do not vote.

attributes.action: Return Scottish devolved powers to UK Government and Parliament
attributes.background: Devolved Powers have not delivered real benefit to the people of Scotland and Many people are disillusioned by the Government and constant demands for Independence Referendums.

attributes.action: Scrap the variable speed limits as a traffic calming measure on the M25
attributes.background: I feel the variable speed limits cause unnecessary traffic on the motorway, cause accidents and add extra stress to daily driving on the motorway, I understand when there is an accident or incident on the motorway it is necessary  but used as a 'traffic calming' measure' doesn't work.
attributes.additional_details: 90% of the time driving on the m25 there is a 60mph 50 and 40 limit imposed where drives slow down under the gantry to around 30mph which causes drivers to brake and further down turns into stand still, once national speed limit is in place the traffic is clear. this is guaranteed in the same places, almost every day in peak hours.

attributes.action: Mandatory for ALL eye tests to include Pupillary Distance (PD).
attributes.background: Without the Pupillary Distance (PD) it is impossible to create prescription glasses, get the distance wrong and depending on how inaccurate it is, can cause the following symptoms: blurry vision, double vision images, headaches, nausea, and fatigue.
attributes.additional_details:
- 69% of the UK population wear prescription glasses
- Online retailers can be 40% cheaper than high street opticians
- It is unfair that people on lower incomes are forced to buy cheap     glasses when they could afford fashionable frames and lens if they could buy from online retailers.
- Opticians don't provide PD today pointing to Statutory Instrument (1984 No. 1778). This was last reviewed in ’84 the internet was just for email then!! So this badly needs an update.

attributes.action: Bring the limit to claim for unfair dismissal down from 2 years to 12 months
attributes.background: This petition is to bring the limit in taking their employer to a tribunal for unfair or constructive dismissal which you don't have much chance if you have to be there for more than 2 years, if we can get it dropped to 12 months it may give people in the work place a better chance financially!
attributes.additional_details: You must have worked for your employer for a minimum period before you qualify for the right to claim unfair dismissal at a tribunal. If you're classed as an employee and started your job on or after 6 April 2012 - the qualifying period is normally 2 years. It should be dropped to 12 months to give people a bit more security in work and to stop employers getting rid of employees under ridiculous excuses and giving the employees a leg to stand on!
